</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the velocity (speed vector) of the vehicle as an array with format [x, y, z]. Vector is in model space.  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''velocityModelSpace''' vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[velocityModelSpace]] _chopper;
[[comment]] "Returns [X (left(-) right(+)), Y (backward(-) forward(+)), Z (down(-) up(+))]";
</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setVelocityModelSpace]], [[velocity]], [[speed]], [[setVelocity]], [[setVelocityTransformation]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

[[Category:Arma_3:_New_Scripting_Commands_List|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 3|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 11, 2014 - 02:55 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This function is useful for helicopters as it returns Z vector like an indicator of thrust/load ratio. More or less climb (+) or descent (-) tendency but:
As X,Y,Z vectors are relative to vehicle attitude, this function doesn't return a climb or descend rate (as the attitude of the vehicle can be far from horizontal). You can get negative Z vector, in jets, while climbing fast, peeling off in the sky!
More or less, you can use as a Z accelerometer factor but invert the sign: +G acceleration (negative vector below the jet) is -Z here.
If not "physically" correct, the behavior is sufficient enough for Arma flight model.
</dd>
</dl>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 21, 2015 - 02:36 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:K.J.|K.J.]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Previous note is physically incorrect. Velocity can not be used to give information about Thrust/Load ratio or G-Forces/acceleration. To get acceleration you have to create the derivative of velocity after time dv/dt -> the difference of velocity between 2 timesteps divided by the time that passed between the 2 steps.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
